title: Past Simple or Present Perfect Tense Exercise

exercises.title: Past Simple or Present Perfect Exercise

questions.question: I ................................ here when I was a child.
questions.description: Here the clause 'when I was a child' clearly shows that we are talking about something completed in the past. The present perfect is not possible here.

questions.question: I .................................. her since last year.
questions.description: We prefer the present perfect tense with the time expressions since and for.

questions.question: She ................................... unhappy since she left school.
questions.description: We prefer perfect tenses with the time expressions since and for.

questions.question: 'Where is John?' 'He ........................ here ten minutes ago.'
questions.description: We do not use the present perfect tense with time expressions referring to the past.

questions.question: They ................................... the contract last week.
questions.description: The present perfect tense is not used with past time expressions.

questions.question: She ............................... ill for a long time.
questions.description: Perfect tenses are preferred with the time expressions since and for.

questions.question: Somebody ............................ their umbrella in the lobby.
questions.description: We use the present perfect tense to talk about completed past events when there is no reference to time.

questions.question: ................................ a ghost?
questions.description: We use the present perfect tense to refer to a period of time that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: I can't get into my house because I .................................. my keys.
questions.description: When there is no time reference we use the present perfect tense to talk about finished events.

questions.question: Sophia .................................... absent since Monday.
questions.description: We prefer perfect tenses with the time expressions since and for.

questions.question: You can't see him now because he ............................. home.
questions.description: When there is no time reference, we use the present perfect tense to talk about finished actions.
